docs.title: Welcome to TaskTracker
docs.text: TaskTracker is a fictional task management system designed to help teams organize their work efficiently.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Task Management: Create, assign, and track tasks with ease
  • Team Collaboration: Work together with your team members in real-time
  • Priority Levels: Organize tasks by priority and deadlines
  • API Integration: Automate workflows with our REST API

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: New to TaskTracker? Check out our Quick Start Guide to get up and running in minutes.

docs.title: Documentation Overview
docs.text:
Section Description User Guide Learn how to use TaskTracker effectively API Reference Integrate TaskTracker with your applications For Developers Set up your development environment

Disclaimer

This is a fictional project created for demonstration purposes only.

docs.title: API Overview
docs.text: The TaskTracker API allows you to integrate task management capabilities into your own applications.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text: https://api.tasktracker.example.com/v1

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All API requests require authentication using an API key.

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

To obtain an API key:

  1. Log in to your TaskTracker account
  2. Navigate to Settings > API Keys
  3. Click "Generate New Key"

docs.title: Rate Limits
docs.text: Plan Requests per minute Free 60 Pro 300 Enterprise 1000

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text: All responses are returned in JSON format.

docs.title: Success Response
docs.text:
{
  "success": true,
  "data": { ... },
  "message": "Operation completed successfully"
}

docs.title: Error Response
docs.text:
{
  "success": false,
  "error": {
    "code": "VALIDATION_ERROR",
    "message": "Invalid input data"
  }
}

docs.title: Available Endpoints
docs.text:
Endpoint Method Description /tasks GET List all tasks /tasks POST Create a new task /tasks/{id} GET Get a specific task /tasks/{id} PUT Update a task /tasks/{id} DELETE Delete a task

For detailed information about task endpoints, see Task Endpoints.

Disclaimer: This is a fictional API for demonstration purposes.

docs.title: Task Endpoints
docs.text: This document provides detailed information about the task-related API endpoints.

docs.title: List Tasks
docs.text:
Retrieve a list of all tasks.

GET /v1/tasks

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description status string Filter by status (todo, in_progress, review, done) assignee string Filter by assignee ID priority string Filter by priority (low, medium, high, urgent) limit integer Maximum number of results (default: 20) offset integer Pagination offset (default: 0)

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "tasks": [
      {
        "id": "task_123",
        "title": "Review documentation",
        "description": "Review and update API documentation",
        "status": "in_progress",
        "priority": "high",
        "assignee": {
          "id": "user_456",
          "name": "John Doe"
        },
        "created_at": "2026-02-20T10:00:00Z",
        "updated_at": "2026-02-22T15:30:00Z"
      }
    ],
    "total": 1,
    "limit": 20,
    "offset": 0
  }
}

docs.title: Create Task
docs.text:
Create a new task.

POST /v1/tasks

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
{
  "title": "string (required)",
  "description": "string (optional)",
  "assignee_id": "string (required)",
  "priority": "string (optional)",
  "due_date": "string (optional, ISO 8601 format)"
}

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
{
  "title": "Implement new feature",
  "description": "Add export functionality to the dashboard",
  "assignee_id": "user_456",
  "priority": "high",
  "due_date": "2026-03-01T00:00:00Z"
}

docs.title: Get Task
docs.text:
Retrieve a specific task by ID.

GET /v1/tasks/{task_id}

docs.title: Path Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Description task_id string The unique identifier of the task

docs.title: Update Task
docs.text:
Update an existing task.

PUT /v1/tasks/{task_id}

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
{
  "title": "Updated task title",
  "status": "done"
}

docs.title: Delete Task
docs.text:
Delete a task permanently.

DELETE /v1/tasks/{task_id}

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Task deleted successfully"
}

Disclaimer: This is a fictional API for demonstration purposes.

docs.title: Development Setup
docs.text: This guide will help you set up a local development environment for TaskTracker.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed:

  • Node.js v18.0 or higher
  • npm v9.0 or higher
  • Git
  • Docker (optional, for containerized development)

docs.title: Getting the Code
docs.text:
Clone the repository:

git clone https://github.com/your-username/tasktracker.git
cd tasktracker

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Install the project dependencies:

npm install

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Copy the example environment file:
cp .env.example .env
  1. Edit .env with your local configuration:
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://localhost:5432/tasktracker
API_KEY=your_development_api_key
PORT=3000

docs.title: Database Setup
docs.text:
Run the database migrations:

npm run db:migrate

Seed the database with sample data (optional):

npm run db:seed

docs.title: Running the Application
docs.text:
Start the development server:

npm run dev

The application will be available at http://localhost:3000.

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
Execute the test suite:

npm test

Run tests with coverage:

npm run test:coverage

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
tasktracker/
├── src/
│   ├── controllers/
│   ├── models/
│   ├── routes/
│   └── services/
├── tests/
├── docs/
└── package.json

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
1. Create a new branch for your feature
  2. Make your changes
  3. Run tests to ensure everything works
  4. Submit a pull request

Disclaimer: This is a fictional project for demonstration purposes.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Welcome to TaskTracker! This guide will help you create your first task in just a few minutes.

docs.title: 1. Creating an Account
docs.text:
Navigate to the application website and click "Sign Up".

Tip

Use a valid email address to receive important notifications about your tasks.

docs.title: 2. Creating Your First Task
docs.text:
After logging in:

  1. Click the "New Task" button in the top navigation bar.
  2. Fill in the required fields:
    • Title: "Review project requirements"
    • Description: "Collect and document requirements for the new module"
    • Assignee: Select yourself from the dropdown list.
  3. Click "Create" to save your task.

docs.title: 3. Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you've created your first task, you can:

  • [ ] Explore the full guide on working with tasks
  • [ ] Learn about API capabilities for automation
  • [ ] Customize your notification preferences in Settings

Remember

This is a fictional project created for demonstration purposes.

docs.title: Working with Tasks
docs.text: This guide covers all the essential task management features in TaskTracker.

docs.title: Task Properties
docs.text:
Each task in TaskTracker contains the following properties:

Property Description Required Title A brief summary of the task Yes Description Detailed information about the task No Assignee The team member responsible Yes Priority Low, Medium, High, or Urgent No Due Date When the task should be completed No Tags Labels for categorization No

docs.title: Creating Tasks
docs.text:
To create a new task:

  1. Click New Task in the navigation bar
  2. Fill in the task details
  3. Set the priority and due date (optional)
  4. Click Create

docs.title: Editing Tasks
docs.text:
You can modify any task at any time:

  1. Click on the task to open it
  2. Click the Edit button
  3. Make your changes
  4. Click Save

docs.title: Task Statuses
docs.text:
Tasks progress through the following statuses:

  • To Do: New tasks waiting to be started
  • In Progress: Tasks currently being worked on
  • Review: Tasks awaiting review or approval
  • Done: Completed tasks

docs.title: Deleting Tasks
docs.text:
Warning

Deleted tasks cannot be recovered. Proceed with caution.

To delete a task:

  1. Open the task
  2. Click the Delete button
  3. Confirm the deletion

Note: This is a fictional project for demonstration purposes.
